name: WebScriptObject
desc: A WebScriptObject object is an Objective-C wrapper for a scripting object passed to your application from the scripting environment.

items.name: func jsObject() -> JSObjectRef!
items.desc: Returns the JavaScript object corresponding to the receiver.

items.name: func removeWebScriptKey(String!)
items.desc: Removes a property from a scripting environment.

items.name: func webScriptValue(at: UInt32) -> Any!
items.desc: Returns the value of a property at the specified index.

items.name: func setWebScriptValueAt(UInt32, value: Any!)
items.desc: Sets the value of a property at the specified index.

items.name: func callWebScriptMethod(String!, withArguments: [Any]!) -> Any!
items.desc: Returns the result of executing a method in the scripting environment.

items.name: func evaluateWebScript(String!) -> Any!
items.desc: Returns the result of evaluating a script in the scripting environment.

items.name: class func throwException(String!) -> Bool
items.desc: Raises an exception in the current script execution context.

items.name: func setException(String!)
items.desc: Raises a scripting environment exception in the context of the current object.

items.name: func stringRepresentation() -> String!
items.desc: Returns a string representation of the receiver.
